		Question: what is the political system of south africa
		Answer:
answer: The political system of South Africa is a democratic republic with a capitalist economy. The country has a long history of political instability and a difficult transition to a constitutional democracy. Currently, South Africa is a full-fledged democratic republic. As part of a post-apartheid transitional arrangement, two racial groups have political parties that dominate the political landscape: the Bantu (African) National Congress (ANC) and the Freedom Front Plus (FFP) (formerly the National Party (NP).
